title: Corsair
data:
The **Corsair**, formerly the **Korsair**, is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") that appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). It is based on [Fyr's Pirate YANI](/wiki/User:Fyr/YANI/Pirate "User:Fyr/YANI/Pirate"), with some slight changes from the initial implementation - the source code notes that there may be an eventual implementation of the [Voodou](/wiki/User:Fyr/YANI/Pirate#Vodou "User:Fyr/YANI/Pirate") abilities mentioned there. Like [Pirates](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate"), Corsairs know many items by their [Pirate names](/wiki/Pirate#Pirate_names_for_items "Pirate").

Their first sacrifice gift is the [Queen's Guard](/wiki/Queen%27s_Guard "Queen's Guard").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Skills](#Skills)
- [2 Techniques](#Techniques)
- [3 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [4 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
- [5 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
- [6 Quest](#Quest)
- [7 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [8 Gods](#Gods)

## Skills

| Corsair skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| -------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max            | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Basic          | - *Weapons:* [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- *Spells:* [divination](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells")                                                                                                                                            |
| Skilled        | * *Weapons:* [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident"), [firearms](/wiki/Firearms "Firearms")
* *Combat:* [bare-handed combat](/wiki/Bare-handed_combat "Bare-handed combat") |
| Expert         | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [whip](/wiki/Whip "Whip"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber")
- *Combat:* [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat")
- *Spells:* [attack](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells")                                                            |

The Corsair's [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [cause fear](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cause_fear "Spellbook of cause fear"). Spell success is determined by [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence").

## Techniques

Corsair do not gain any specific [techniques](/wiki/Technique "Technique") in SlashTHEM.

## Intrinsics

- XL 1: [Swimming](/wiki/Swimming "Swimming")
- XL 2: [Searching](/wiki/Searching "Searching")
- XL 7: [Stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")

[attrib.c line 187](https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/e55b2b522cea66b463dd8a81d74f9b8ad7fa7bb3/src/attrib.c#L187%7CSlashTHEM)

## Starting equipment

- a +1 [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar") (cutlass)
- 7 +1 [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")
- a random [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring")
- an [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack")
- a blessed [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze") (rum)
- a random [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin")
- a [cram ration](/wiki/Cram_ration "Cram ration")
- a random [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine")

[u\_init.c line 411](https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/51cb303d5a40d4374ef6212c78ac85f4901e9885/src/u_init.c#L411%7CSlashTHEM)

The Corsair also starts with a random amount of gold (1-300) and a randomized [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") that is one of:

- a [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog")
- a [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten")
- a [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat")
- a [monkey](/wiki/Monkey "Monkey") named Ugga-Ugga
- a [baby crocodile](/wiki/Baby_crocodile "Baby crocodile") named Snappy

[dog.c line 48 - pet\_type()](https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/fe43ec2eb65b372b10e40d288e4448d1375607fd/src/dog.c#L58%7CSlashThem)

[dog.c line 187 - makedog()](https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/fe43ec2eb65b372b10e40d288e4448d1375607fd/src/dog.c#L58%7CSlashThem)

## Rank titles

In SlashTHEM, the [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- XL 1-2: Lubber
- XL 3-5: Swabby
- XL 6-9: Deckhand
- XL 10-13: Bilge Rat
- XL 14-17: Helms\[wo]man
- XL 18-21: Navigator
- XL 22-25: Bosun
- XL 26-29: Mate
- XL 30: Commodore

SlashTHEM role.c line 249

## Quest

The [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees the Corsair fighting [Spearathan](/index.php?title=Spearathan\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spearathan (page does not exist)") in the [Grotto of Souls](/index.php?title=Grotto_of_Souls\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Grotto of Souls (page does not exist)") for the [Pearl of Wisdom](/index.php?title=Pearl_of_Wisdom\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pearl of Wisdom (page does not exist)"), a neutral [ring of wisdom](/index.php?title=Ring_of_wisdom\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ring of wisdom (page does not exist)") which provides [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") when carried, [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") and [half physical damage](/wiki/SPFX_HPHDAM "SPFX HPHDAM") when worn, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") as a [scroll of magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping").

[artilist.h line 783](https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/e55b2b522cea66b463dd8a81d74f9b8ad7fa7bb3/include/artilist.h#L783%7CSlashTHEM)

## Strategy

The early game of a Corsair plays much like a [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"). Their +1 [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") are superb for dealing with early enemies at range in addition to their helpful oilskin sack. However, their limited HP will become a factor during the midgame unless they can find ways to compensate for it. Their first sacrifice gift [Queen's Guard](/wiki/Queen%27s_Guard "Queen's Guard") is a definite boon for damage output but is not incredibly impressive. If their build allows for it, Corsairs can take advantage of their expert skill in [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") to increase their damage output significantly to bridge the midgame deficit. Their quest artifact [Pearl of Wisdom](/index.php?title=Pearl_of_Wisdom\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pearl of Wisdom (page does not exist)") grants slotless [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), which can free up other precious equipment slots. Its other properties are less interesting. The base item [ring of wisdom](/index.php?title=Ring_of_wisdom\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ring of wisdom (page does not exist)") is not generally a desirable use of a ring slot, and the [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage") is slightly overshadowed by [The Hand of Vecna](/wiki/The_Hand_of_Vecna_\(SLASH%27EM\) "The Hand of Vecna (SLASH'EM)"). The invokable [magic mapping](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping") is typically a convenience boost by the time they acquire it, but can be handy for mapping SlashTHEM's lengthy [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), especially when locating [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower").

## Gods

The SlashTHEM pantheon for Corsair is taken from [Haitian Vodou](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haitian_Vodou "wikipedia:Haitian Vodou").

- Lawful: Erzulie Freda
- Neutral: Marassa Jumeaux
- Chaotic: Papa Legba

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Corsair

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Corsair, formerly the Korsair, is a role that appears in SlashTHEM. It is based on Fyr's Pirate YANI, with some slight changes from the initial implementation - the source code notes that there may be an eventual implementation of the Voodou abilities mentioned there. Like Pirates, Corsairs know many items by their Pirate names.

Their first sacrifice gift is the Queen's Guard.

Contents

  • 1 Skills
  • 2 Techniques
  • 3 Intrinsics
  • 4 Starting equipment
  • 5 Rank titles
  • 6 Quest
  • 7 Strategy
  • 8 Gods

Skills

Corsair skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: pick-axe, short sword, dart
  • Spells: divination
Skilled
  • Weapons: long sword, knife, axe, polearms, spear, trident, firearms
  • Combat: bare-handed combat
Expert
  • Weapons: dagger, scimitar, whip, saber
  • Combat: two weapon combat
  • Spells: attack

The Corsair's special spell is cause fear. Spell success is determined by intelligence.

Techniques

Corsair do not gain any specific techniques in SlashTHEM.

Intrinsics

  • XL 1: Swimming
  • XL 2: Searching
  • XL 7: Stealth

attrib.c line 187

Starting equipment

  • a +1 scimitar (cutlass)
  • 7 +1 daggers
  • a random ring
  • an oilskin sack
  • a blessed potion of booze (rum)
  • a random tin
  • a cram ration
  • a random figurine

u_init.c line 411

The Corsair also starts with a random amount of gold (1-300) and a randomized pet that is one of:

  • a little dog
  • a kitten
  • a sewer rat
  • a monkey named Ugga-Ugga
  • a baby crocodile named Snappy

dog.c line 48 - pet_type()

dog.c line 187 - makedog()


Rank titles

In SlashTHEM, the status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

  • XL 1-2: Lubber
  • XL 3-5: Swabby
  • XL 6-9: Deckhand
  • XL 10-13: Bilge Rat
  • XL 14-17: Helms[wo]man
  • XL 18-21: Navigator
  • XL 22-25: Bosun
  • XL 26-29: Mate
  • XL 30: Commodore

SlashTHEM role.c line 249

Quest

The quest sees the Corsair fighting Spearathan in the Grotto of Souls for the Pearl of Wisdom, a neutral ring of wisdom which provides magic resistance when carried, shock resistance and half physical damage when worn, and can be invoked as a scroll of magic mapping.

artilist.h line 783

Strategy

The early game of a Corsair plays much like a Rogue. Their +1 daggers are superb for dealing with early enemies at range in addition to their helpful oilskin sack. However, their limited HP will become a factor during the midgame unless they can find ways to compensate for it. Their first sacrifice gift Queen's Guard is a definite boon for damage output but is not incredibly impressive. If their build allows for it, Corsairs can take advantage of their expert skill in twoweapon to increase their damage output significantly to bridge the midgame deficit. Their quest artifact Pearl of Wisdom grants slotless magic resistance, which can free up other precious equipment slots. Its other properties are less interesting. The base item ring of wisdom is not generally a desirable use of a ring slot, and the half physical damage is slightly overshadowed by The Hand of Vecna. The invokable magic mapping is typically a convenience boost by the time they acquire it, but can be handy for mapping SlashTHEM's lengthy Gehennom, especially when locating Vlad's Tower.

Gods

The SlashTHEM pantheon for Corsair is taken from Haitian Vodou.

  • Lawful: Erzulie Freda
  • Neutral: Marassa Jumeaux
  • Chaotic: Papa Legba

rawPage:
The '''Corsair''', formerly the '''Korsair''', is a [[role]] that appears in [[SlashTHEM]]. It is based on [[User:Fyr/YANI/Pirate|Fyr's Pirate YANI]], with some slight changes from the initial implementation - the source code notes that there may be an eventual implementation of the [[User:Fyr/YANI/Pirate#Vodou|Voodou]] abilities mentioned there. Like [[Pirate]]s, Corsairs know many items by their [[Pirate#Pirate_names_for_items|Pirate names]].

Their first sacrifice gift is the [[Queen's Guard]].

The Corsair's [[special spell]] is [[spellbook of cause fear|cause fear]].  Spell success is determined by [[intelligence]].

==Techniques==
Corsair do not gain any specific [[technique]]s in SlashTHEM.

==Intrinsics==
* XL 1: [[Swimming]]
* XL 2: [[Searching]]
* XL 7: [[Stealth]]

The Corsair also starts with a random amount of gold (1-300) and a randomized [[pet]] that is one of:

==Rank titles==
In SlashTHEM, the [[status line]] shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified [[experience level]]:

==Quest==
The [[quest]] sees the Corsair fighting [[Spearathan]] in the [[Grotto of Souls]] for the [[Pearl of Wisdom]], a neutral [[ring of wisdom]] which provides [[magic resistance]] when carried, [[shock resistance]] and [[SPFX_HPHDAM|half physical damage]] when worn, and can be [[invoke|invoked]] as a [[scroll of magic mapping]].

[https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/e55b2b522cea66b463dd8a81d74f9b8ad7fa7bb3/include/artilist.h#L783|SlashTHEM artilist.h line 783]

==Strategy==
The early game of a Corsair plays much like a [[Rogue]]. Their +1 [[dagger]]s are superb for dealing with early enemies at range in addition to their helpful oilskin sack. However, their limited HP will become a factor during the midgame unless they can find ways to compensate for it. Their first sacrifice gift [[Queen's Guard]] is a definite boon for damage output but is not incredibly impressive. If their build allows for it, Corsairs can take advantage of their expert skill in [[twoweapon]] to increase their damage output significantly to bridge the midgame deficit. Their quest artifact [[Pearl of Wisdom]] grants slotless [[magic resistance]], which can free up other precious equipment slots. Its other properties are less interesting. The base item [[ring of wisdom]] is not generally a desirable use of a ring slot, and the [[half physical damage]] is slightly overshadowed by [[The Hand of Vecna (SLASH'EM)|The Hand of Vecna]]. The invokable [[magic mapping]] is typically a convenience boost by the time they acquire it, but can be handy for mapping SlashTHEM's lengthy [[Gehennom]], especially when locating [[Vlad's Tower]].

==Gods==
The SlashTHEM pantheon for Corsair is taken from [[wikipedia:Haitian_Vodou|Haitian Vodou]].

* Lawful: Erzulie Freda
* Neutral: Marassa Jumeaux
* Chaotic: Papa Legba
